name: The Toren

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you T/A for your recommendation on yet another wonderful boutique hotel! We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay here. The Toren Hotel's rich theatrical atmosphere set the scene for a romantic and intriguing Amsterdam. The hotel decor was opulent and our room was richly furnished to a high standard. The room was spotlessly clean with great bathroom facilities. Pleasant, welcoming and helpful staff made our stay here a memorable one. The Toren is centrally located in the pretty Jordaan district - perfect for transport needs and sightseeing. You are spoilt for a variety of eating places nearby. The two restaurants that we particulary enjoyed a meal in are 1. Cafe Dereiger in Nieuwe Leliestraat 34 and 2. Restaurant de Luwte in Leliegracht 26-28. Excellent food and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Opulent Splendor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife, 14 year old son and I recently spent 3 days at the Toren and our experience was exceptional. We chose the Toren because of the Trip Advisor ratings and recommendations and I can say the Toren met and exceeded our expectations. We have travelled extensively in Europe and the staff at this hotel is as good as it gets. And that goes for every employee we had interaction with. Every detail of our needs was attended to with genuine interest. Nicole, the Assistant- Front Office Manager, was extremely friendly and helpful as she patiently helped us with bike rentals and boat tour reservations. Our room was clean and very comfortable with a great view of the canal. The Breakfast, and the breakfast room itself, was outstanding. We very much enjoyed the ambience at breakfast each morning. I highly recommend the Toren and will return to stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed five nights at The Toren and were more than pleased with our experience. The front desk never stopped looking after our every need. They were interested in our plans and did everything possible to help make them happen. The room was charming, and the breakfast excellent. The hotel has an arrangement with a one Michelin star restaurant, 'Christofe', around the corner to provide snacks or full meals for room service. We chose to dine at the restaurant our last evening and were served a fabulous gourmet meal. The location is excellent as one can walk to the city centre, or the train station with ease, or use the nearby tram. Our very positive perception of Amsterdam was clearly enhanced by our 'Toren' experience. The Toren is tops!!
reviews.title: The Toren is Tops

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Eleanor Huber, Canada
reviews.title: Charming old world charm with modern conveniences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We very much enjoyed out three-night stay at the hotel in mid summer. It was fun to see the decor, which captured traditional Dutch hotel style, with steep stairs (which could be avoided by a well placed elevator) and an excellent range of offerings for breakfast. It is a much appreciated break from American standard furnishings. Great location just around the corner from the Anne Frank House and numerous fine restaurants within easy walking distance from the hotel.
reviews.title: Stylish boutique - great location - lovely staff
Fantastic!!!!!!
reviews.text: ok, so this hotel is not enormous and the rooms are not big but this is normal for Amsterdam. (and accomodation is never cheap here). However, this hotel is FANTASTIC - full of charm and character. rooms are spotless and homely. the location is the best in this city - on a quiet canal street, very safe and peaceful yet only minutes on foot from the lively cafes and restuarants. I have stayed here 5 times now and last time took friends who have since returned on their own and stayed here again. I would always book this hotel as a first choice. The bar area is gorgeous and i have always found the staff to be superb. Tip - if you are returning to this hotel, email them directly for reservation enquiries instead of using their web site search and tell them you have been before and would like to come back. they always send a personal email back and offer me a 10% discount. Check out the pancake factory round the corner, a superb cafe with the most amazing choices of pancake.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: stay at Toren - you will love it!
reviews.title: Great hotel
Toren Excellence
reviews.text: The Toren is in a great location, quite street but only a couple of minutes from Dam square and just around the corner from Anne Frank's house (Be there first thing for best visit). The Toren is a very elegant and charming hotel with excellent staff in a laid back style. Although the rooms were not huge they were spotlessly clean, very comfortable beds and a good air conditioning system (Amsterdam was very hot when we were there). We have stayed in Amsterdam at least 12 times on a mix of business & pleasure and the Toren is by far the best hotel for the money that I have stayed in in Amsterdam. Highly Recommended and I will most certainly be back.

reviews.title: Chic and Plush!
reviews.text: Not just a super location but a really stylish boutique hotel. I had the good fortune to pick this hotel and to book a Superior room with canal view, I can only say that if I didn't have to attend various meetings I would have been happy to stay in this room all day, decadent interiors, plush furnishings, a Nespresso Machine! (Yes in my room!) and a whirlpool bath make a stay in the Torens truly delightful. The staff were most friendly and helpful and the breakfast was pure joy - FRESHLY SQUEEZED OJ! - and there is a really cool bar. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

reviews.title: Wonderful Amsterdamse Hotel in the heart of the canal belt
reviews.text: Elizabeth - Ireland

reviews.title: Perfect location
reviews.text: This wonderful hotel is in a fantastic location, central and in walking distance of anywhere you would want to go. In the heart of the famous canal belt, overlooking the Keizersgracht Canal, with the Jordaan and the 9 Staatjes on the doorstep, and perfectly placed for a stay in Amsterdam.

reviews.title: Great little hotel
reviews.text: The hotel was really lovely, a real little boutique gem. Our room was pretty small, but to be expected from a city centre hotel, especially in Amsterdam, however it was immaculately presented, beautifully decorated, and the bed was so comfortable we nearly didn't make it up in the morning. The bathroom was also small, but with a great powerful shower and lovely Rituals toiletries for that extra touch of luxury, you couldn't ask for more. The staff were very helpful, and friendly, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a 3 night stay in The Toren with my BF. We stayed in a standard double...got a great deal on the hotel website, only 250euro for the 3 nights!! Breakfast wasn't included as we usually sleep in past breakfast when we are away!
reviews.title: Fab Hotel....loved it!

likes.disliked: — There are alot of narrow, steep stairs so not very disabled friendly but it is Amsterdam!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: loved the look and feel of the hotel...the decor is amazing and really added to the romantic feel of our holiday...they put up the xmas decorations while we were there and they were fab...look at the pic of the bar! The room was small enough but definintely manageable.....bed was sooo comfy and loved all the pillows! Bathroom was spotless with a fantastic power shower and a bath...i'm a bit of a monica when it comes to cleanliness and am very fussy about what hotels we stay in, so was impressed with the overall cleanliness of the entire hotel as well as our room. Rooms were quite warm but air con was available... a mini bar was also in the room but there was enough space to put in our own big bottles of water to keep them cool throughout the night.
reviews.title: Loved every second

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very nice, efficient, our check in was litterally 2 mins, our bags were brought to our room and when we asked for a late checkout on our last day we were allowed to stay until 1pm instead of the usual 11am without any additional charge. They stored our bags afterwards so we could still walk around Amsterdam in comfort until we had to leave for the airport.

reviews.title: Like nothing you've seen before

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I travelled to Amsterdam with a friend, and was originally going to stay in budget accommodation. My friend didn't fancy this and searched online and found the Toren. It was worth the extra cost. It's in an excellent location and all the main sights and attractions are really easy to get to, from Anne Franks house to the Red Light District. The staff were very accomodating, polite and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Excellent boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the The TOREN and can only say great things about this Hotel... The staff were suburb. Very friendly and very kind and people went out of there way to acommadate us and to look after us over and above the line of duty.... From making our reservations in Toronto all the way until we left the Hotel we wew looked after from the amazing staff. They called taxis for us and made reservations for us and even sent us a complimentary fruit basket......It was worth it..... We felt like we were in a palace and the Hotel rooms were very romantic and beautiful. We recommend this place to everyone and would only stay here when we return. On behalf of my girlfriend and I we have the highest regards for everyone at the Hotel TOREN and cannot thank them enough for helping make our vacation so pleasant in every way and assisting us with making our dream vacation come true.
reviews.title: The Hotel Toren was a dream come true of a hotel and superb staff to'' perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our room (especially when compared to other European hotels that we've had in the past). Roomy, a good view of the canal, great location, working AC, clean, good and free breakfast. No free internet.
reviews.title: Great room with a view and an air conditioner that works.

reviews.text: Very well located,nice staff,an excellent room with a magic Jacuzzi and an expresso machine for coffee and tea at any time.The breakfast was the best in all Europe....
reviews.title: Such a charming hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Toren for 3 nights. On the plus side, the location is perfect -- the neighborhood was in a quieter part of town and less overrun with day-tripping tourists. Our room faced the canal, which is was pretty and quiet. The staff are very friendly and amicable and spoke excellent English (as did nearly everyone we met while in Amsterdam). The hotel/room decor is an upgrade from your larger hotel chains.
reviews.title: Good, but some issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was in a excellent location. We could walk to shopping and restaurants. The hotel staff at the front desk made us feel welcome the moment we arrived. We had a "canal" view room in front and I would recommend that accommodation. I definitely would stay here again and have already recommended it to a friend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay in the annex. The front desk staff and porter were extremely friendly and helpful. They helped make dinner reservations for us. The decor is unique and old-world style. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Amsterdam
reviews.title: Great stay in unique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came to Amsterdam for our 'Mini-Moon' last week as it is our favourite city, and we decided to stay in a more up market hotel and treat ourselves. We first booked for two nights in the Deluxe Jacuzzi room and thought we could go and stay in another hotel fo our remaining went tnights due to the budget. However because we fell in love with the place we ended up staying the full 5 nights - this brought pros and cons as the hotel was busy so we had to switch rooms every day - however they put us in the Royal Suite for our final night and we have never seen anything like it!
reviews.title: The best hotel I have ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: On the first day we arrived we were too early to check in but we left our bags in reception and headed out, when we returned we mentioned we were on our mini moon and there was a 10 minute delay getting into our room. We then were taken to our room and inside the starff had placed a bottle of Moet champagne, chocolates and strawberrys, and a personal letter from the hotel owners. We were over whelmed by the class, design and space of the room - not to mention the HUGE jacuzzi bath that could easily fit 3-4 people in. every little detail down to the soap was well thoyght out and it went well beyond our expectations.
reviews.title: First-class boutique hotel, perfect location, fabulous service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in a few 4-5* hotels over the years and this one without a doubt wins hands down. I don't know what the standard rooms are like but if you want a 1-2 night treat then I would definitely recommend a jacuzzi room - ask for 403 if it is available and I promise you won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I went to Amsterdam for a long weekend break and The Toren was recommended to us. The Hotel itself is in an excellent location being right in the heart of the canals, with 'coffee shops' 5 minutes one way, red light 10 mins another, shops 5 mins another, many good restaurants and cafes and shopping areas, museums etc all within walking distance.
reviews.title: superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It took us ten minutes to walk from the train station which was only ten mins on train from the airport. Keizergracht and Herongracht are the most beautiful streets in Amsterdam but then even the red light district - except for more rubbish was still beautiful in its architecture. The whole area felt very safe and it was very easy to grab a tram a couple of streets away from The Toren upto the museum area. The staff at the hotel could not be any more helpful, polite and engaging. They loaded us with maps, umbrellas and advice. We were left a complimentary bottle of Moet with chocs and strawberries as it was our anniversary. We went over gay pride weekend and although it was all going on, on the next canal along from us - as soon as you went down the side street - all people and noise disappeared You are only a stones throw away from the Westertoren church which are the bells Anne Frank listened to from her secret annexe and her house/museum is literally 2 minutes round the corner from The Toren. The Dutch where amazingly nice kind helpful and tolerant and a good vibe was felt all around us. The room was'nt massive but by gosh they are decorated beautifully and strolling along the cobble streets by old fashioned street lamps, our Hotel stood out in the distance due to its high level of curb appeal and two burning oil lamps that you could see from afar. it was reasonably priced for the high quality furnishings and location and I cannot recommend it highly enough!! And wow the bed was comfy....must do's - Anne Frank's, van Gogh museum, redlight area and coffee shops. These are not all seedy hangouts for students. The locals are so acustomed to the weed laws there that to sit and have a coffee and joint - even if you are a 65 year old classy dame! - is the done thing here. They have very strict rules which means no underage or loud mouths allowed. very well organised and policed and indeed we did not see any trouble what so ever like you might get with drunkerds!
reviews.title: Fabulous for a romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Toren (we booked the royal bridal suite) for three nights with my wife on our 20th anniversary. We wanted a romantic weekend in a luxurious, comfortable and sexy setting, and on these counts, although it does not come cheap, it does not get any better. The (slightly decadent !) decor of this hotel is original and astounding. Everything is geared for your pleasure, and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. We had told Mr Toren this occasion was our annivesary, and a bottle of champagne - and not the the cheap stuff - awaited us in our room. My only quibble is the poor state of the furniture on the little rooftop mezzanine outside the room. Location is perfect - on a pretty canal close to the center, yet sufficiently out of the way to get away from the hustle and bustle. Highly recommended for couples.
reviews.title: Fabulous for a romantic getaway

reviews.text: we stayed in the special deluxe room with a canal view and jacuzzi, and i highly recommend this type of rooms! it was quite big, very comfortable with a big bed, with huge windows and great view of the canal. the receptionist lily helped us to arrange for a little boat trip and it was an amazing experience. i would only say that we had a small difficulty opening the windows (due to old wooden frames and high humidity in the city), but this was a smaller issue.
reviews.title: My new favorite hotel in Amsterdam!
Nice place
reviews.text: We stayed one night here, had a view of the canal outside. room was very comfortable; staff was not particularly friendly. we never heard about any food offered here. The bathroom smelled like sewage in the morning unfortunately. I would not choose this hotel again.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.text: This hotel ticks every box. Rooms are beautiful, food was excellent, staff were amazing and so helpful, location was perfect. Had a truely romantic weekend and will definatly stay at this hotel again. On arrival there was a bottle of campagne waiting in our room and the concierge sent up two massures to help my wife and i relax and unwind. Was an incredible weekend, cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

reviews.title: Congratulations to all at the Toren
reviews.text: I have been trying to work out what makes a stay at the Toren such a wonderful experience. I think the key is the 'culture'. Management and staff are to congratulated on such a high level of friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, approachable, efficient service. Every member of staff whom we met had the same positive attitude and several went out of their way to enhance our experience in Amsterdam. Yes the hotel's position is excellent, yes it was great staying in a room with a canal view, yes the decor is fun...but it is the people who make this hotel such a success.

reviews.title: Above and beyond
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to all major attractions in the city, yet is in a much more desirable, quieter area right on a canal. The staff was exceptional and went out of their way to accommodate our early arrival and provided free drinks and a bottle of champagne in our room. The breakfast is delicious and we appreciated the "North American" style bathrooms which included a shower/tub, hair dryer, universal power outlet and towel warming rack. The only thing we didn't enjoy was the soft bed and feather pillows, but that is a personal preference.

reviews.title: dramatic luxury
reviews.text: The hotel was beautiful and the service great. A little overpriced for the small single, though the hotel did include breakfast as an upgrade which was a nice touch to balance the cost. Quiet location, yet near the sights of Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I simply loved this hotel. After booking staff informed me that the 1-person room would be small and offered a discounted upgrade. But I loved my little room. Everything was there.
reviews.title: Coziest hotel ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simply perfect, well decorated, wonderful bed ( slept like crazy) and no noise.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: To get there and find fresh strawberries and chocolates waiting is simply splendid!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great service, ideal location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was superbly friendly!
reviews.title: Fantastic, friendly service and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned from a 3 nights stay at The Toren. What a hotel! The staff are very helpful and polite and the room was fantastic. Don't let the idea that your room may be a few doors down the street - it is just as well decorated and integrated as the main hotel. Lovely bed with sumptious pillows, nice view over the back of the gardens. Although we heard the church bells at night it was somewhat comforting and didn't disturd us at all. I had noticed one night that the room nextdoor was a little loud in the corridor however not a peep could be heard once in our room. The bathroom was well stocked every day and spotless. (We came across the cleaners a few times and they were very polite too!) A very short walk back to the main hotel gave us an excellent breakfast - the staff even remembered our preference for tea or coffee this morning! BBC 1& 2 was available on the TV so something to watch if you need and the iPod dock was also used. Great location, just around the corner for Anne Franks Museum and walking distance of much else if you care to admire the views. My wife had commented that the 'plastic decorations' in the breakfast/bar area looked a little odd but this was an extremely minor part of the stay. We would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came to this hotel via the tourist information office in Amsterdam, after a disastrous experience at the Hotel Aadam Wilhelmina in the same city (see the 'Mice Love It', under Wilhelmina on TripAdvisor). It was like visiting a different planet. Staff were extremely welcoming and courteous, the surroundings comfortable and relaxing, and the room everything we desired (including a great view of the canal). The hotel was also well situated. It was certainly expensive -- but considering that it rescued our holiday, it was money well spent and we'd happily return there again.
reviews.title: A touch of class
Overpriced and undersized
reviews.text: After extensive research as well checking the hotel's website I asked our travel agent to book this hotel for us. Upon arrival we were showed around the main building, shown the lovely breakfast room / bar; then came the shocks: "By the way your room is not in this building, it is in our annex; also breakfast is not included either." The annex happened to be about 10 houses down the road, a real run-down, dirty old place with our either canal or garden view promised room turned out to look over some toilet block between the 3rd and 4th floor. The room was so small that our luggage almost didn't fit, there weren't enough coat hangers, there was a kicked in hole on the bathroom door, numerous light globes were missing and so on. As we were charged 170.00 Euros for this, we felt totally ripped off and could stand one night only, before we moved to a better, nicer and a lot cheaper hotel just next door. It is possible that the main building is OK, but the secondary building wouldn't be good enough for a student dormitory.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006
reviews.text: Just returned after our 25th anniversary break at this lovely hotel. It's an old renovated canal house with usual narrow stairs but good lift. We booked a junior suite and had a great canal view and a real espresso machine for our regular coffee fix.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Toren is a great small hotel, elegant in design and professionally run by staff who make you feel at home away from home. This was our first visit to Amsterdam and we wanted a location close to the Anne Frank House and the Westerkirk as well as convenient to other sights and sounds of the city. Location for us was perfect. Amsterdam is such a beautiful and interesting city and our 4 day stay there was only too short. But the service and kindness of the Toren's staff made such a difference to us in being able to navigate to different venues in the area and around the city. Especially appreciated was the kindness of staff when my wife sprained her ankle during one of the museum visits, providing ice and pointing us to medical assistance and nearby pharmacies (Apothek) as needed. The Toren's elevator (lift) was especially appreciated (rare for for small hotels here) at that point.
reviews.title: Our stay at the Toren was wonderful, a kind and helpful staff, very welcoming to first time visitors in the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for several days. First room was a small room in the front, which was noisy, particulary on Saturday night. The next few nights were in a room adjacent to the lovely back garden. This was terrifc. Only problem was keeping the air temperature adjusted. But everything else was 5 star quality, particularly the helpful staff.
reviews.title: Plush and Romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a lovely small hotel in a wonderful area of town. Our room albiet small was cozy and romantic. The bed was so comfortable with lovely linens. The nespresso machine with all those delish coffees was a real treat. There was some construction in the neighborhood, and a bit of noise due to a jackhammer, but that is to be in a very old city. When we had a small problem, the staff was professional, quick and accomodating, even going so far as to take 50% off our nights stay. I am not sure if they have larger rooms, as this would be quite tight for more than a couple of days. The carpet could use a shampoo, but that would be our only complaint., and my husband hit his head on the chandelier a few times, but I would never take that out of the room, as it makes the room so pretty. Thank You Hotel Toren.
reviews.title: Comfy beds, good location but no real concierge service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay in The Toren and was even better than the first.
reviews.title: Unbeatable service!!!
The Toren - Change the Name to "The Friendliest Toren with the most helpfull staff
reviews.text: This time we made the reservation 3 months in advance in order to get a Deluxe room in the main building, canal view with a huge jacuzzi. The room was amazing, luxurious, elegant, comfortable, decorated in reds, purple and black, and with lots of details as different scenes with the ilumination control panel.

reviews.title: Very friendly staff
reviews.text: The view to the canal is lovely, and we thought that being in the first floor was even better because the feeling you get is that you are actually on the canal, as you can see the boats passing from the bed. Talking about the bed, one of the most comfortable we slept in our 14 day travel, you get the feeling is that you are in a "King's bed"!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were given an invitation for a welcome cocktail, and we tried a barman's suggestion: a new champagne with fresh strawberries..delicious!
reviews.title: Good hotel for couples, less so for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Undoubtedly, the main asset of this hotel in our view, besides the location and luxury, are the girls at the reception: they take care of everything concerning the guest stay. They are incredible attentive.
reviews.title: Feel at home ambiance, cozy and warm, mix of fashion and old style - a nice experience in Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on my experience the hotel is average. The rooms and location are ok. The reception girls are nice and trying to be helpful. Breakfast is quite basic, an average european hotel has better selection. Service? Really no much to hype about. Tried to have lunch in their bar and it took them literally 45 minutes to cook sandwiches that we ordered, never gave them a second chance and ate outside then. Next day asked to have my trousers pressed as I had to go to a business meeting and that turned out to be "mission impossible". Poor maid tried to iron them twice but that did no good. Tonight they had a promotional party for some kind of new alcoholic drink. Would have been nice hadn't they forgotten to consider those guests who don't drink and go to bed after dinner. It's now 11:30 pm and I'm awake thanks to the drunk voices shouting aloud downstairs. Well, not the end of the world but next time I'll probaby stay somwhere else.
reviews.title: why so much hype?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel with friends. We booked it as a birthday treat and it certainly was. The staff were friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable. The room was fantastic, beautifully decorated and well equipped. The hotel is very well situated for exploring the city. Overall I can highly recommend this hotel for quality service.
reviews.title: Birthday treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Toren is superb. The service is the best we have received anywhere in the world and the staff are friendly, helpful and professional, without being intrusive. The hotel itself is beautiful, ideally located alongside a canal, with beautiful, sumptuous decor and delicious breakfasts. From the moment we enquired about availability, to the moment we reluctantly departed, we were treated like VIPs. If you are looking for a fantastic hotel, The Toren is the place to go!
reviews.title: Best hotel we have ever stayed at!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checked in for 4 nights into a Jacuzzi Room. Perfect thing to do in Amsterdam. The room was great value for money, Jacuzzi perfect. The staff was extremely forthcoming and helpful. Our matresses were too soft and we told them - they exchanged them immediately. Whatever small issue we had was addressed immediately. Special thanks to Sebastian for the excellent VIP service - even after Holland lost the football :)
reviews.title: Great place, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our Honeymoon in this fabulous hotel, and have vowed to return for our anniversaries, such was the quality of the hotel, it's location, and most of all the exceptionally friendly and professional staff. Their recommendations led us to explore a more genuine side of Amsterdam, and we were always pleased to return to enjoy the hotel's facilities. On the day we left, the judges had visited to decide if the hotel had won best 4star boutique in the Netherlands; we can't think of any reason why it wouldn't- the staff and owners really deserve it. Couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough, we can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Honeymoon Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed in this lovely hotel in May. Because there were three of us we were put in the annex of the hotel just a few doors down. Just as nice though. The Hotel was really nice, staff couldn't do more to help us and I would definitely stay there again. Its in a fantastic location with the canal just on your doorstep. Along with the Anne Frank museum just around the corner as well as the canal boat tour. Lots of lovely shopping and many places to go to eat and drink. What was nice was that you were in the middle of everything but away from the tourist group area and red light district. If you can afford to upgrade your room do, I believe they are superb! Amsterdam has lots of steps and stairs so not really advisable for anyone less abled. The hotel has a lift inside but not sure if how you would access from outside.
reviews.title: The Toren

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't imagine a more perfect hotel to add to the charm of Amsterdam. Though we are back home in Australia now, our memories of the Toren will stay with us. It is such a warm and romantic old hotel and it transports you back to another era. Whilst all staff were friendly, efficient and helpful, Wendy was exceptional. Thank you Wendy for your restaurant recommendations. We loved the Italian restaurant and we loved the fact that we were the only non-locals there. I think that the Hotel Toren is my favourite hotel in the world.
reviews.title: Great Service and Style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel after arriving in Amsterdam on a cruise ship. We arrived at the hotel at 0900 and were made very welcome, the staff allowed us to check-in and leave our bags which were then delivered to our room. The reception staff were excellent and gave us lots of advice on how to enjoy our first day.
reviews.title: Stylish Boutique hotel in great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were disappointed on our return to the hotel to discover we had been checked into the annex which is about 75m down the road. The annex was fine but I don't deem that to be staying in the same hotel (illogical?). Access to the rooms is up steep stairs which would be difficult for someone with physical disability although there is an elevator.
reviews.title: Best service ever! Exceptional!
Small cozy room
reviews.text: The decor (black and silver) is dramatic and an acquired taste. Our room was very comfortable with good facilities, particularly the Nespresso machine.

reviews.title: Terrific Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: I selected the Toren based on it's location and the previous reviews. I travelled with my 3 daughters--16, 12 & 12. The location was perfect--easy to get to all venues, close to the Canal bus stop, around the corner from the Anne Frank House (go after 7 pm if you can--no line!)

reviews.title: very special toren
reviews.text: Every member of the staff bent over backwards to make us comfortable. We arrived early, in the rain, and came to the wrong entrance. Immediately they began to set up the room, adding a second bed in a VERY large room, overlooking the canal. From house-keeping to reception, they were extremely friendly, professional, and concerned for our well-being.

reviews.title: Suited Us To a T!
reviews.text: The chef is outstanding. The breakfast buffet was the best that we had during our trip--and we were in 8 different hotels during our stay.

reviews.title: A great experience
reviews.text: I will definitely return to The Toren on a future trip--just with my husband this time! It is very romantic, and the service is just outstanding! Thank you.

reviews.title: Romance in the Heart of Amsterdam!
reviews.text: my wife and i stayed a the toren for 6 nights,the room was very comfortable,with good aminities and a fantastic view over the canal,

reviews.title: Right Place at the Right Time
reviews.text: We were travelling to Europe for the World Cup and paid a visit to Amsterdam. The World Cup seemed to have driven up hotel prices in Amsterdam, but the rates at the Hotel Toren were reasonable, which was a main reason for our decision to stay there. The hotel was in an excellent area of Amsterdam - within walking distance of all of the attractions and the train station but in a quiet enough neighborhood. We stayed in the second house in a standard room which was small but, like another reader mentioned, that was fully disclosed in the website so we were not surprised. The room and bathroom were clean but the biggest plus - especially considering that this was the hottest week in Amsterdam in years - was the excellent AC. We've stayed in hotels all over Europe and experienced the often weak air conditioning and we were pleasantly surprised that the AC at Toren was powerful and kept our room cool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: We normally don't care about hotel bars, but this bar was charming. The bartender was friendly and chatty but above all the prices were reasonable and we were pleasantly surprised by the bar tab at the end of our stay. We also made a couple of international and were charged a very reasonable rate. The only drawback was that by being in the second house, we felt a bit cut off from the main house and the bar, which was probably a minor inconvience all things considered.
reviews.title: No complaints at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Rarely make these types of posts but we so enjoyed our stay that we thought our positive experience would be helpful to finicky Americans and other travellers alike. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation.
reviews.title: Loved it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Toren is a very luxury , guest free hotel in the middle of Amsterdam. All the main spots are in walking distance. We went there with our small boat , and it was no problem to lay the boat near the Hotel. Our room was very luxury and nice , and the staff was very friendly.
reviews.title: The Toren , a great experience

reviews.text: The service was great. We felt very welcome. I would surely recommend this hotel to my

reviews.title: A wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Kind Regards , Merel van den Burg
reviews.title: Super stay! Great service and location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Nestled on a quiet canal in Amsterdam stands The Toren Hotel, swathed in the elegance and history of a 17th century canal house. Split between two buildings just a few doors apart, The Toren offers a tranquil resting spot from the throngs of visitors to the city. Meanwhile, the warm staff is happy to offer assistance to their guests.
reviews.title: excellent!!!

aka: The Toren - Hampshire Classic Hotel Amsterdam
description: Treat yourself to an unforgettable experience. Whoever wants to be treated to a unique and memorable stay in Amsterdam should stay at The Toren. The hotel's elegantly designed interior and warm welcome, combined with the beautiful surroundings of Amsterdam's central canal area create a special atmosphere and a safe haven for you to completely relax. The hotel has been designed with your pleasure in mind! Worldwide tourists and business travelers familiar with the hotel will discover it afresh.
